programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: Principal Brown gives Gumball and Darwin the ancient school hamster, Chris Morris, to look after for the weekend. However they accidentally leave it at school, and take home a clump of Principal Browns hair instead. Surprisingly they discover it makes an excellent pet! When they realise they have left the real Chris Morris at school, they have to race to find him before their error is discovered.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: When Darwin and Gumball reveal how theyd spend their perfect day, Gumball confesses that he would spend it with Penny. Darwin gets jealous and sets out to dig some dirt on Penny, hoping it will split them up. Meanwhile Gumball is planning to step his and Pennys relationship up a notch, by proposing marriage!

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: Granny Jojo has brought a boyfriend to her birthday meal and Dad isnt happy about it. He bans Granny JoJo from ever seeing Louis again. When the kids get caught sneaking Granny Jojo out of the house, Dad challenges Louis to a man-off to prove once and for all who is the man of the house?!!

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: The Wattersons complain about their day and order a pizza from Larry. When they call to complain about their late pizza its the final straw for Larry and he quits all of his jobs. Elmores fragile commercial structure collapses and the citizens revert to a more primitive apocalyptic state.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: From a high-speed police chase to the inside scoop on Daisy the Donkey, Channel 6 Elmore News has all the top hard-hitting local stories. Experienced newscaster Kip Schlezinger is the man to bring you the latest news, sports and weather, even when there is absolutely nothing to report...

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: The Amazing World of Gumball revolves around the life of Gumball Watterson a 12-year-old cat who attends middle school in the fictional city of Elmore. Accompanied by his adoptive goldfish brother and best friend Darwin he frequently finds himself involved in various shenanigans around the city during which he interacts with his other family members - sister Anais and parents Nicole and Richard - and an extended supporting cast of characters. With relatable themes and a unique cast of characters The Amazing World of Gumball exemplifies the funny amazing sweet and optimistic side of kids everyday life. Injected with a good deal of humor and unpredictable nonsense Gumballs world reflects the modern family and everyday issues that kids understand.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: When Darwin asks Gumball to teach him how to skate Gumball makes sure that he covers every aspect of the skating lifestyle - from wearing the right gear using the right terms and choosing the right board. But when Darwin finally gets his wheels rolling he realises there might be one important aspect of skating that Gumball hasnt taught him...

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: When Darwin has lunch with Idaho he decides to stop eating potatoes in solidarity with his brotato. However he finds his obsession with his favourite food harder to kick than he ever imagined, so Gumball decides to help his friend curb his carb cravings.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: Gumball kind of teaches Darwin how to be a skater… / Darwin finds it harder than expected to give up his favourite foodstuff. / Gumball becomes a sorcerers apprentice / Gumball Darwin and Anais find themselves plunged into an RPG version of Elmore.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: When Gumball is given a cursed video-game console Elmore becomes trapped inside a fantasy RPG world. Gumball, Darwin and Anais have to battle their way through town, unravelling the secrets of their new virtual reality. But theyll have to level up if theyre going to stand any chance against the mysterious final boss...

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: The family go to visit Richards Dad. Based on his basic living standards and extended absence from Richards life, they assume Frankie must have done a stretch in the slammer. When Frankie comes to stay with the Wattersons, they decide the way to make him comfortable is to make him uncomfortable and turn their house into a prison.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: Gumball and Darwin are confused when they meet Kiki and Quack, a pair of siblings that copy everything they do and say. Then they find out this copycat family is making money online from imitating the Watterson family! When they fail to encourage them to find their own identity, the Wattersons realise they need a more permanent solution...

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: When Gumball and Darwin realise Grandpa Louie has no friends on Elmore Plus, they feel bad. So they create one - called Muriel. However when Granny Jojo finds out Louie has been spending time online with another woman, Muriel not existing isnt going to stop her being destroyed.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: The Wattersons discover a family of cartoon copycats who mimic their every move. / Grandpa Louie has a new online friend - the only problem is she isnt real. / The kids find out that Richard has been being picked on by the same person since high school. / Gumball and Darwin decide to use online reviews to wrangle free stuff. / A mysterious package shows up at the Wattersons house and they do their best to avoid opening it. / Darwin likes a girl in his class so Gumball decides its time to play cupid. / Gumballs smart answers arent the correct ones and hes forced to go back to kindergarten. / Gumball and Darwin discover the real reason Dads diet wasnt working. / Gumball discovers that Rob his old nemesis is neme-seeing someone else now.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Pregnant Doc: During a chase, Specs accidentally swallows Lamput. The Docs plan to bring Lamput back to the lab! However, Specs gets misunderstood by bystanders as a pregnant mother in labor and gets dragged to a hospital against his will. While Specs gets used to being a mother-to-be, Skinny tries to get the two of them out of the hospital and back to the lab. Will Lamput stay in Specs tummy this whole time?Reverse: In a new attempt to catch Lamput, The Docs invent a remote that reverses anything back in time. Lamput must try to escape while constantly being pulled back into the Docs grasp!

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: The Docs prove their inventing skills by coming up with an age-altering time-ray. This breakthrough could change the world. If they used it for something other than chasing Lamput. Obsessed much, fellas? Wildly shooting their time-ray off in public causes a not-unsurprising amount of chaos, until the local law enforcement gets caught in the cross-fire. Looks like the Specs and Skinny are gonna be in jail till they get old the normal way.

This time Duncan, Gwen, Courtney, Izzy, Noah, Bridgette and the rest find themselves in the past as kids and their adventures take place in kindergarten. The strict Chef Hatchet is there to keep his eye on them. Any harmless idea of the kids turns out to be a total disaster, they are irrepressible in producing new ideas on how to have fun. the kids are discussing every single decision and plan in front of the cameras just like their adult versions, being a part of a reality show.

programme.desc: After failing to open a jar Chef believes hes past his prime and entering his twilight years. This prompts Beth and the kids to dig up something from his youth to rejuvenate him. That something turns out to be a ventriloquist dummy named Sue.

programme.desc: Chef and the kids take a field trip to Sugars farm but ignore all of Sugars strict and boring farm rules has dire consequences when Chef and the kids unleash a herd of ravenous "Were-hogs" on a full moon.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: The Amazing World of Gumball revolves around the life of Gumball Watterson, a 12-year-old cat who attends middle school in the fictional city of Elmore. Accompanied by his adoptive goldfish brother and best friend Darwin, he frequently finds himself involved in various shenanigans around the city, during which he interacts with his other family members - sister Anais and parents Nicole and Richard - and an extended supporting cast of characters. With relatable themes and a unique cast of characters, The Amazing World of Gumball exemplifies the funny, amazing, sweet and optimistic side of kids everyday life. Injected with a good deal of humor and unpredictable nonsense, Gumballs world reflects the modern family and everyday issues that kids understand.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders

programme.title: Mr Bean

programme.title: Mr Bean

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Whilst browsing the supermarket for lovely grub, Mr. Beans life-long pal, Teddy, is kidnapped. Bean tracks down the nasty men responsible and finds that Teddy is not their only captive. Mr. Bean rescues a hundred teddy bears once their ears are put through an industrial sewing machine.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: The Lemmings pace around the log cabin searching for virtual animals to capture with their tablet game. Annoyed by their behavior, Grizzy throws them outside. Determined to continue playing, the Lemmings trick the bear. But when the tablet hits the circuit breaker and explodes, the gaming animals come to life! Ice dinosaurs, laser caribous and giant carnivorous plants. The life-size hunt can begin!

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: A snowstorm rips the solar panels off the log cabin and Grizzy can no longer watch TV or enjoy the comforts of home! But he has a brilliant idea. He produces electricity by making a caribou run on a treadmill, using the last carrot in the house as bait. But the Lemmings absolutely want his carrot to make the perfect snowman.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Grizzy discovers in shock that the TV has been replaced with a trompe-loeil image. Furious, he flushes the Lemmings out of their hiding place where theyd hoped to watch their favorite cartoon in peace and propels them as far as possible. They land in an ancient cave where a powerful spirit capable of entering individuals is asleep. The Lemmings decide to free the spirit and send it to Grizzy. But will they be able to control the spirit?

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Not easy to enjoy a DVD about salmon when the Lemmings are having a disco party right there. Grizzy sends them packing with such force that they land at the research station, where they discover a state-of-the-art U.V. cabin. When turned up to the max, the light therapy and music options can advantageously replace the disco equipment Grizzy destroyed. The noise they make causes a block of ice to break off. It hurdles down the slope to the cabin and destroys Grizzys TV. But it doesnt take the bear long to figure out that the U.V. cabin also has a DVD function.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: The Lemmings have fun destroying ice towers. When Grizzy sees them, it inspires him to sculpt statues of himself. The Lemmings cannot resist the temptation to destroy the statues of Grizzy, who does everything in his power to protect them.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: A container adrift along the icefield will change the lives of Grizzy and the Lemmings: its an inexhaustible stock of chocolate spread! There is so much, that for the first time the close enemies have no need to fight over the treat. They entice a flock of penguins into hoisting the container out of the water. One of the penguins, who did not get his reward in fish, is disgruntled. Grizzy has him taste the Yummy, then throws the jar far away to get rid of the penguin. The chocolate treat spreads over the icefield. Fatal error?

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Grizzy uses a fire extinguisher to chase the Lemmings from the living room so that he can take a nap, but the gadget accidentally flies out the window. It lands at the top of an ice cliff, causing a fissure, and the peak of the cliff topples. Amid the debris, the Lemmings discover a fearsome creature: the Yeti, who is looking for the guilty party. The Lemmings bring him to Grizzy, never dreaming that the giant will immediately fall in love with the Rangers cabin and throw a very original party.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Joonisfilm raagib grislikarust nimega Grizzy ja mitmest lemmikust.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: As Mr Bean settles down to watch his favourite TV programme he hears loud noises from next-door. He moves from house to garden but cant escape the relentless cacophony of trumpets, electric drills, and screaming babies. Beans mind turns to thoughts of revenge….

programme.desc: Envious of all the attention his landlady is receiving because of a broken leg, Mr. Bean decides to "break" his leg too. When he ends up in hospital under the care of the Matron from Hell he discovers there are some kinds of attention even he doesnt enjoy.

programme.title: Mr Bean

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean fancies a game of golf so he creates his own golf course inside his flat and invites Irma to join him for a round. programme.desc: Mr Bean is tidying his flat and chucking out a load of old unwanted junk. programme.desc: The Lemmings create a customized hang-glider using a supermarket shopping cart for the nacelle and a ventilator as an engine. programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: Hildie is mixing a batch of foot balm thatll soften and beautify her gnarly-looking feet. She has Tom rub it in, nice and good. Unfortunately, the foot balm is a little too strong and makes her foot disappear. Hildies recipe may be a foot balm bomb but it gives Tom a good idea. Hell use it to "vanish" into thin air. Jerry literally doesnt know what hit him when the invisible cat bats him around like a ball of yarn. Tom is unaware when the effects begin to wear off and Jerry is able to defend himself. When Jerry gets a hold of the cream, its his turn to have the upper hand. A battle of the vanishing cream ensues, each using it in various ways to outwit the other.

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: Its Toms wedding day! Hes getting married to Toodles in a backyard wedding that were experiencing through the eyes of his best friend, Jerry. programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: Tykes got a problem and it all began when the pup stepped on a wood plank. The same wood plank Tom discarded after using it as a hockey stick to slap Jerry (the puck) into the goal (the doghouse). Now Tykes got a painful splinter in his paw and since Tom was charged with watching him while a sickly Spike naps, Toms tasked with trying to remove the splinter before Spike wakes. Tom makes a few painful (for them both) attempts to remove the sliver with no success. Hearing Tykes whimpers, a sympathetic Jerry decides to help Tom out. In the end, Tom and Jerry get the splinter out but not before inflicting equal doses of pain while trying a myriad of home remedies from a hot bath, to tweezers, to adhesive tape, to glue, and more!

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: Jerry brings Tom to consciousness. His partner has an aluminum bat on his head, arrow in his butt, bee stings on his arm, tire treads on his back, lipstick on his cheek and a terrible case of amnesia. Jerry must help Tom use the investigative clues on his body to solve what happened. The clues will take them to some destinations that may leave Tom more physically abused than when he started but in better mental shape (as each stop causes a little more memory to return).

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: We open on a SOLD sign in front of what will be Rick and Gingers house. Inside, the house is empty - no Rick, no Ginger, no Tom, no furniture. Just Jerry, who slip slides merrily across the bare floors - the place all to himself. That is until the front door opens and Rick and Ginger arrive in their new home. Ginger screams having just seen a mouse and tells Rick to get Tom out of the moving van. Like most cats in a new place, Tom doesnt want to come out from beneath the recently placed couch, but Ginger demands he catch that mouse! And so we watch the beginning of a lifelong adversarial relationship unfold one gag at a time!

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: The Lemmings find a strange card game representing the elements along with instructions. The idea is to pretend that the ground is on fire or of ice, like in the game "Floor is Lava." They transform the cabin into a giant adventure trail. Depending on the card drawn, they must avoid zones on the floor with flames or wax. Grizzy unceremoniously gets rids of the setup to regain control of the cabin. One of the cards lands on a stone slab that transforms into lava. The Lemmings are delighted: they will be able to play "for real"!

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: The Lemmings discover a very particular cocoa tree with chocolate-spread sap! Reduced to eating canned Brussels sprouts, the only remaining food in the cabin, Grizzy is baffled when he sees the Lemmings parading past to equip themselves with all sorts of containers: ladles, soup spoons, bowls, buckets, basins, etc. He watches them through binoculars and discovers that they have planted a faucet in a tree where chocolate spread flows. Grizzy decides to siphon off their tree.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Grizzy expels the Lemmings from the cabin where they had built a cumbersome obstacle course. Peaceful at last and feeling lazy, he is determined not to leave his couch. The Lemmings discover a magic Mayan disc that allows you to choose instantaneous mutations of other animals features: bat wings, reindeer antlers, elephant trunks, etc. The mutant Lemmings return to the cabin, determined to continue playing their game while enjoying their new accessories.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: As they fight over the last jar of chocolate spread, Grizzy and the Lemmings accidentally send it flying deep into the jungle. They both set out in search for the jar, but in a forest that dense, its an impossible mission. In a Mayan Temple, the Lemmings discover a magic bracelet that increases ones sense of smell tenfold and use it to find the jar. Grizzy loses their trail, but finds some Mayan bracelets himself: one for eyesight and one for hearing. Enough to infallibly track down the Lemmings!

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Just as Grizzy is about to go to bed, he ousts the Lemmings who are holding a surprise party in the cabin. The Lemmings land in a Mayan Temple devoted to the moon. While toying with an ancestral console, the Lemmings set off a cosmic phenomenon that brings the moon, which is now the size of a disco ball, to the temple. In its aura, gravity becomes very weak. Enough to get rid of Grizzy and have a very original fiesta.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Grizzy does his best to get rid of the Lemmings and enjoy some peace and quiet in the cabin, but each time they come back with a new and even more-disturbing activity. When he sees some penguins marching in a perfectly disciplined line, Grizzy decides to teach the Lemmings how to behave in his presence. He locks himself up with them inside the garage, which has been transformed into an elementary school classroom. Grizzy is determined to make discipline reign but he has forgotten about the Lemmings natural penchant for bedlam.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Grizzy and the Lemmings fight once again and cause an accident with Santa Claus sled. The Lemmings rush to the crash site and get their hands on Santas magic bag. While Grizzy is tidying up the cabin after their fight, he is baffled to see the Lemmings come back him, quiet and calm. The rodents break out into Christmas carols and prepare a delicious snack for Grizzy before slipping out again. Suspicious, Grizzy follows them and discovers that the bag rewards persons whose wishes are equal to their goodwill.

programme.title: Karbikool
programme.desc: The bugs talk about trying new things.

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: Tom and Jerry have to contend with a baby polar bear that has been mistakenly delivered to Rick and Gingers house.

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: An animated series following the antics of a cat named Tom - who is always in pursuit of a mouse named Jerry - and the rivalry between the two characters. Tom, Jerry and Rick try to relax in an automatic chair, only to cause mayhem outside.

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: A scarecrow terrorizes Catsylvania.

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: Ginger is asked by her mother to watch her dog Goliath while she is away. Goliath is a gentle giant unless you wake him from his nap!

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: An animated series following the antics of a cat named Tom - who is always in pursuit of a mouse named Jerry - and the rivalry between the two characters. The Martian Mice make mischief for Spike and Tom.

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: An old pair of Gingers tap shoes turns Tom into a tap dancing fanatic.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Beans landlady is hopping mad on finding molehills on her lovely croquet lawn. Bean looks to get hammered if he does not rid the old lady of the cuddly little half-blind culprit. He fails dismally with his eccentric mole extermination methods and ends up simply taking the pesky rodent for a ride.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Beans tranquillity is shattered by deafening roadworks outside his bedroom window. Threats, sabotage and subterfuge all fail to quell the cacophony until Bean has the ingenious idea of feeding the workmen into peaceful submission. But the silence ends with a bang!

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean likes nothing more than to relax on his sofa with a good meal and his favourite telly programme. Unfortunately, a painful explosion of springs under his bottom puts an end to that. He sets about buying another one… but, alas, sofas are expensive items. TV dinners may well be a thing of the past for Mr Bean.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: The animated antics of the hapless bumbler Mr. Bean. Mr. Bean finds a treasure map in a dark and cobwebby corner of his attic, but its tricky clues lead him up the chimney, round the bend, down the garden path, up the blinking wall and nearly all the way to Australia!

programme.title: Moley
programme.desc: Squirm and Manny find a shiny ring while out fishing, but a mysterious creature lurks in water below

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Grizzy cant believe it: he has just swallowed a spoonful of his favorite food, chocolate spread, and he hates it! How could that be possible? And yet, when he swiped the jar from the Lemmings, they seemed to be enjoying it immensely. A quick investigation reveals that the Lemmings added a dash of lemon juice to the jar to give the spread a sharper taste. And they intend to jazz up the rest of the stock as well!

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Grizzy discovers the fondness of his beloved she-bear for meditation. To seduce her, he sets out to prove to her that he too can attain the Zen attitude. This demands practice, of course, but it especially demands lots of willpower and concentration to get rid of the rowdy Lemmings without losing ones temper.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Grizzy and the Lemmings discover a super-secret Canadian Army prototype which resembles a simple computer keyboard. It has only several command keys: select, cut and paste, and delete, but the keys act directly on surrounding elements... as well as on living beings!

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: The Lemmings are having a blast with a bowling game they found in the Rangers storeroom. Grizzy hastens to destroy the pins to ensure his peace and quiet. But the Lemmings discover a remote-control device that can modify the balls weight. By setting it on maximum, the ball could knock over much more than pins: furniture, a bear and even a log cabin!

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: After the rains, to the great delight of the Lemmings, strange bouncing mushrooms have sprouted in the yard. To put an end to the Lemmings noisy games - which prevent Grizzy from enjoying his peace and quiet - Grizzy tramples the mushrooms. Only to realize that each crushed mushroom frees a cloud of spores that instantly creates… a bunch of identical mushrooms.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: The Lemmings have laid hand on special magnets which turn any object they are stuck to into flying objects. Grizzy bears the consequences and is ejected out of the cabin on his couch, which has turned into a flying-couch. Upon landing, Grizzy discovers by chance that the magnet stuck to his forehead enables him to fly like Peter Pan.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: With a lion-tamers whip, a sugar bowl and lots of work, the Lemmings have successfully trained a caribou to go through their obstacle course. Grizzy cannot help but admire the performance. He decides to steal their idea, and the caribou, to create his own circus act and impress his lovely she-bear.

programme.title: Meet the Batwheels
programme.desc: Tour the glittering night sky with Batwing, Gothams flying protector with a penchant for posing, as she dips, dives, and dodges through buildings and water to take on villains and bail out a friend or two - set to her funky-fresh theme song.

programme.title: Batwheels

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Theres easy money to be had in the art world and Mr. Bean is set on getting some of it. Once equipped with the right tools, he ventures into the countryside with a blank canvas in search of inspiration - and comes home with a painting full of life. Literally.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: After a head-on collision with the milkman, Mr. Beans landlady is rushed to hospital, leaving him to look after her odious one-eyed cat Scrapper. Fur isnt the only thing that flies and in the end its Bean that needs looking after.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean is delighted with his new "ship in a bottle" until it mistakenly ends up on a milkmans float. He frantically pursues his prize possession, only to see it disappear into a milk bottling plant at the local dairy. Getting it back promises to be a mission of the impossible.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: With his teddy bear at the dry cleaners, Mr. Bean finds himself feeling lonely. Fortunately, a new playmate appears in the shape of a goldfish from the garden pond. Bean has a great time with his new best friend until, at the seaside, he discovers that some fish are gigantic, have large pointed teeth and fins on their backs.

programme.title: Mikk-Mikk ja seenerahvas

programme.desc: Dorothy and friends have a wonderful day playing an Ozian version of lawn bowling. Its like regular bowling, but its bigger and more magical. programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz
programme.desc: Wilhelmina gets jealous of Dorothy having Toto as a pet. When she hears about the Oz Pet Show, she decides to create a fierce and beastly pet of her own that will win the whole show!

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz
programme.desc: The Wicked Witch is quite sick of Christmas and has a plan to ruin the festivities this year. She bewitches this years tree, Tall Tim, to freeze everyone and everything in Oz as soon as the Christmas Eve party begins! When Dorothy and friends have no way to stop Tall Tims rampage, they figure out that the Wicked Witch is behind all this. They realize the only way to stop her is by melting her icy heart! Or else Oz will be frozen solid!

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz
programme.desc: With Oz nearly completely frozen and the Wicked Witchs plan almost complete, Dorothy and friends get the idea to re-stage A Christmas Carol, disguise themselves as ghosts, and visit the Wicked Witch in the night to get her to change her wicked ways. When it backfires and the Wicked Witch is enjoying her evil deeds too much, they have to think quickly to get her to reverse the spell and unfreeze Oz!

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz
programme.desc: The Wicked Witch has a plan to lure Dorothy and her friends to a made-up Ozian Carnival to get them on a roller coaster thatll send them all the way to the underground Land of Naught forever!

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean is feeling very left out when he discovers that Mrs Wicket is having a huge party downstairs and apparently he isnt invited. Bean tries every trick in the book to sneak himself into the party - even resorting to hiding inside an enormous cake. If only he knew the real reason for the celebration.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Beans attempt to cut the grass is thwarted by a pesky root which refuses to budge. When Mr Bean breaks his spade he heads to the local Garden Centre to find a replacement. But instead of simply buying one he enters a gardening competition to win one - judged by none other than the Queen herself! Its gardening gloves off when Mr Bean goes into battle with his rival green-fingered competitors.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean and Irma are off for a day at the seaside. Irma is travelling light but Bean wants to take almost everything his owns in an enormous trunk. Arriving at the seaside Beans trunk gets accidentally swapped with a trunk belonging to a famous stage magician. As Bean entertains Irma pulling rabbits out of hats the angry magician arrives on the scene - and hes not a happy bunny.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean loves playing in the neighbourhood soft play centre - bouncing on the trampolines whizzing down the slides and most of all immersing himself in the ball pool. But he doesnt like sharing the place with all those annoying kids. So Bean decides to turn his flat into his own private play area where he can play in peace. Unfortunately Irma Mrs Wicket and The Bruisers all want to join in the fun with him.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean orders a takeaway pizza but when it arrives he feels let down by the size of it. So he sets out to bake his own unique Teddy shaped pizzas. Under the name Pizza Bean his pizzas become extremely popular and very soon business in booming. As a result rival pizza producer Don Crustyoni sees his profits plummeting and decides to make Mr Bean an offer he cant refuse.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean is not allowed to fly off on holiday as his passport has no photograph. After failing to get one from a photo booth he tries numerous other ways to get his photo taken including photobombing a tourists snap. None of these work but after Bean is arrested maybe the police can assist him. Say cheese!

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean wants to impress Irma by entering them both into a dance competition at the local park. But his tango is terrible and his rumba ridiculous so he enrols for lessons at a local dance school. After an unsuccessful class at the dance studio and a trip to the library to teach himself Mr Bean has lost track of time. He needs to make it up to a disgruntled Irma but will his homemade effort "win" her over.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean is locked in a department store overnight and has the time of his life. / Mr. Bean becomes obsessed with gaming after being introduced by Mrs. Wickets nephew. programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean becomes obsessed with gaming after being introduced by Mrs. Wickets nephew. He decides he must have his own console, only to discover how expensive they are. programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mrs. Wicket demands that Bean stay in to take delivery of a new lounge chair. Bean accepts because hes starving hungry. How long can he keep up the deception? Long enough to fill his stomach?

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Animation based on the highly popular live action series of the same name, with many of the same characters including the hapless Mr. Bean himself, his long-suffering girlfriend Irma Gobb, Teddy and the mysterious driver of the Reliant Supervan. Two new characters appear, Beans landlady Mrs Wicket and her evil one-eyed moggy Scrapper. The series features little actual dialogue, just the famous mumblings and mild slapstick.

The newly-minted Batwheels are assigned the monumental task of defending the exposed Batcave and facing off with their villainous counterparts, the Legion of Zoom, led by the dastardly supervillain BADCOMPUTER - all without Batmans help!

programme.sub-title: Secret Origin of the Batwheels Pt. 2
programme.desc: With Batman, Robin, and Batgirl unreachable, Batcomputer brings Batmans trusty Batmobile, Bam, to life to help protect the Batcave from a mysterious intruder. / Bam discovers a villainous vehicle squad - the Legion of Zoom - is on the loose and preparing to storm the Batcave.

programme.title: Lucas the Spider
programme.desc: Avocados new toy is driving everyone crazy with its noisy squeaker. Lucas tells everyone that hes going to speak to her. programme.title: Lucas the Spider
programme.desc: Lucas performs epic jumps all around House. Findley is nervous and wishes Lucas wouldnt jump.

programme.title: Lucas the Spider
programme.desc: When Lucas and friends go camping, Avocado tells a scary story. Lucas now thinks theres a ghost in the garden.

programme.title: Barneys World
programme.desc: When Vivie discovers shes not amazing at soccer the first time she tries, she thinks shell never be good at it. Barney creates fantastical practice drills to help Vivie learn how practice can help her get better.

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: Tom and Jerry are in the middle of it when Tom hears someone singing the tale of a cat who met his unfortunate, painful end chasing a much superior opponent. The song is about underestimating your opponent. Every time Tom stops chasing Jerry, the music stops. When Tom resumes, the music resumes. This back and forth continues until the chase takes Tom right past a Singing Uncle Pecos. Tom skids to a stop causing Uncle Pecos to stop singing. Tom wants to prove the lyrics of Uncle Pecos song wrong, but in the end, Toms ego proves to everyone, including himself, that he is very much the subject of Uncle Pecos cautionary tale.

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: After another successful attempt on Jerrys part to elude Tom, Jerry overhears Rick and Ginger talk about the possibility of getting rid of that "useless cat." Rick makes the case that the cat, "just takes up space, only serves one function and doesnt even do that well," and, "they should replace it with something that can get the job done!" When Ginger sounds like shes considering the possibility, Jerry cant believe his ears! Jerry imagines life in the house with a killer cat and decides to do whatever he can to make sure Tom stays. Problem is, Tom thinks Jerrys flagrant attempts to get caught are a trap. In the end, Jerry finds out Rick was talking about that ugly cat doorstop that was a wedding present from Gingers Aunt Gracie. Unfortunately, Toms had enough of Jerrys taunting and is ready to take the bait!

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: Spike hasnt been the best role model for his boy when it comes to being a good sport. You could even say Spikes a sore loser. Thats why Spike recruits Tom and Jerry to help teach the little guy how to lose gracefully. When Tom beats Tyke at a game of tic-tac-toe Tyke puts the "sore" into "sore loser" by biting Toms finger when Tom extends it for a friendly post-game handshake. Tom forces Jerry to take turns playing various games with Tyke (e.g. Checkers, basketball, hopscotch, etc…). Each time they win, Tyke takes it out on them. When Tom and Jerry start throwing the games, Spikes right there to dole out his own punishment for letting Tyke win. Sometimes you just cant win!

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: Tuffy and Jerry are brushing their teeth. Tuffys so tired he uses Jerrys tail instead of his toothbrush. They climb in their respective beds, only Tuffys not in his bed, hes in the palm of Toms hand that Toms made-up to look like a bed. Tom gets walloped for his little stunt but it points out to Jerry that he needs a safer home. What begins with Jerry securing his home from Tom, turns into an arms race between the cat and mouse where they each build their own booby-trapped bunker to protect themselves from each other. They turn out to be their own greatest enemy, with the biggest threat coming from their own creations. In the end, they go back to their relatively safer existence.

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: While using a wand to make inanimate objects come to life to attack Jerry, Tom accidentally zaps a marionette (Marie Antoin-marionette). Now the cat and mouse have more on their hands than either one of them can handle! Sure the marionette pulls Hildie and Beaties heart-strings when they are around (both are thrilled to have another girl in the house even if she is made of wood), but the doll delights in getting Tom into trouble when the witch sisters arent looking. When Marie becomes too much for even Jerry to bear, Tom and Jerry have to figure out how to get rid of the little hellion! They brought her into this world, now theyve got to take her out!

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: Rick and Ginger take Tom and Butch on a cruise ship. Jerry and Tuffy leave to explore the ships buffet and leave Spike and Tom in the room. They all meet Meathead a vicious ship cat who will stop at nothing to terrorize the four of them. They all band together to defeat Meathead but not before they wreak havoc on the ship.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean thinks hes just dug up a valuable coin in the back-garden and goes rushing off to the Museum to have it valued. / Scrapper gives Bean fleas and Bean is forced to call in the pest control person. His flat will take 24 hours to fumigate. Bean begs Mrs. Wicket to let him stay with her. / The Great Eduardo violinist supreme is in town and Irma wants to go to the concert. But Bean wont pay for the tickets. More than that he claims that he can play the violin better. / Mr Bean is in a trance - barks like a dog and starts to dance.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mrs. Wicket becomes annoyingly inconsolable when Scrapper goes missing - calling for him at all hours of the day and night. Bean cant get any sleep! / Mr Bean attempts to retrieve his cash card and "accidently" ends up inside a bank vault. / Mr Bean has to look after an injured Mrs Wicket whose demands start to become a pain. / Mr Bean builds a car washing machine that attracts all manner of customers.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.sub-title: Where Did You Get That Cat?
programme.desc: The animated antics of the hapless bumbler Mr Bean. Mr Bean chases Scrapper around Mrs Wickets flat but her sideboard tumbles over, and when Bean sees a bit of fur poking out from under it, he is horrified to think he has squashed poor Scrapper. Not realising that it is only his landladys furry hat, Bean rushes what he thinks is a flattened cat across town to the vet in a desperate attempt to save his feline friends life.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean becomes a famous internet sensation. / Mr Bean plays gooseberry when Mrs Wicket falls in love with a man Mr Bean doesnt trust. / Mr Bean tries to be romantic but his idea of romance is very different from his girlfriends. / Mrs. Wickets Nephew is staying with her when he wins two tickets to an Outward Bound course. She refuses to go but then ropes in Bean to look after the child.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Grizzy and the Lemmings do not agree on which program to watch on TV. Grizzy confiscates the remote-control device. He thinks hes won the battle, but the Lemmings find another one at the research station. A furious combat begins until the adversaries realize that the research station device has a special button that controls objects.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: The Lemmings have a blast racing down the ice slope in competition with the stuffed Bear-Ranger and manage to win each time. Grizzy cannot stand seeing his avatar humiliated and he decides to enter the competition to help him. Their frenzied descent gets out of hand and everyone is propelled all the way to the hangar of the research station, where they discover an ultra-sophisticated racing game. The racecourse sprawls over the entire icefield via drones that project holographic elements. Grizzy and the Lemmings get into super-fast snowmobiles and launch into the race of the century.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Grizzy watches the Lemmings shave ice from the icefield and whip it into granita, but the result is flavorless. He decides to make granita in an empty jar of Yummy so that the chocolate left over on the sides of the jar will flavor the dessert. Its delicious! The Lemmings, who consider it was their recipe, swap the chocolate granita with another one made in an old flowerpot with potting soil. The choco-granito race is off and running!

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Grizzy and the Lemmings are starving for their reserves are depleted and their fishing has been unsuccessful. Fortunately, a truck delivers a crate of edibles to the research station that contains compact food cubes. When placed under a special light beam, the cubes retransform into delicious meals. Grizzy discovers that the decompressing lamp can, conversely, compact organic elements too. For example, the Lemmings.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: The Lemmings pace around the log cabin searching for virtual animals to capture with their tablet game. Annoyed by their behavior, Grizzy throws them outside. Determined to continue playing, the Lemmings trick the bear. But when the tablet hits the circuit breaker and explodes, the gaming animals come to life! Ice dinosaurs, laser caribous and giant carnivorous plants. The life-size hunt can begin!

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: A snowstorm rips the solar panels off the log cabin and Grizzy can no longer watch TV or enjoy the comforts of home! But he has a brilliant idea. He produces electricity by making a caribou run on a treadmill, using the last carrot in the house as bait. But the Lemmings absolutely want his carrot to make the perfect snowman.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Grizzy discovers in shock that the TV has been replaced with a trompe-loeil image. Furious, he flushes the Lemmings out of their hiding place where theyd hoped to watch their favorite cartoon in peace and propels them as far as possible. programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Its the First Day of Spring and Mr. Bean sets about washing his clothes, his furniture, his teddy and himself. But, alas, theres no hot water! A bit of inventive improvisation with an outside drainpipe proves Mr. Bean to be greener at D.I.Y. plumbing than he thought.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Sometimes Mr. Beans Teddy can be no fun at all. Feeling the need for a new friend, Bean buys a parrot. But getting the parrot past his landlady and her one-eyed cat, Scrapper, proves to be no easy task. Next, is trying to get the blasted bird to speak.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Its a beautiful day at the beach. Bean breathes in the salty air, bliss - and not another soul in sight. What could possibly spoil his perfect day? Answer: British weather. Mr. Bean finds himself chasing an illusive ray of sunshine across town, over hills and dales, a football stadium and the English Channel.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean is shocked when Teddy receives a birthday card from Beans girlfriend, Irma Gobb. The bears Birthday had completely slipped his mind. programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Grizzy is exhausted and the couch has never seemed so enticing! He goes to fetch a pillow and a sleeping mask, but the Lemmings have entirely different plans for the couch. programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Grizzy discovers that the frenzied "break dance" the Lemmings are doing is actually due to the fleas they are infested with. When Grizzy catches them too, its panic all round! Grizzy is determined to eliminate the parasites, down to the very last one. The problem is his little roommates have no desire whatsoever to be treated...

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Another heat wave: even the riverbed is dried up. One very thirsty Grizzy discovers that the Lemmings have used the last remaining bottles of water to fill their inflatable pool. He has no intention of letting the Lemmings swim in what might very well be his last chance to quench his thirst.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: The Lemmings have caught a little spider. Her sticky, elastic threads are absolutely perfect for bungee jumping. programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud

Indeed, next to the supermarket are two jackpot-style machines with slots the size of the lids. But more importantly, theres a key to be won that makes you eligible for the grand prize... the giant jar of Yummy on display under a glass cover.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean wants an ice cream from the ice cream van. But by the time he gets to the front of the queue the ice-cream man has gone to lunch. Bean takes it upon himself to climb through in an open window and into the back of the van from where he starts to help himself. Unfortunately he soon attracts a crowd and is forced to serve a long queue of kids until all the ice cream runs out. When the ice-cream man comes back from lunch and drives away he is unaware that Bean is still hiding in the back of his van en route to the ice cream factory.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Conned by a mechanic into believing his beloved car to be beyond repair, Mr. Bean reluctantly consigns his faithful four-wheeled friend to the car crusher. After choosing hot-air ballooning as an alternative mode of transport, he spots his cherished car from the air… with the unscrupulous mechanic whistling at the wheel! This discovery raises more than Mr. Beans spirits.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Beans Birthday dinner gets off on the wrong foot when he and Teddy are made to take the worst table at a swanky restaurant. The evening is further ruined by a self-obsessed movie star at the next table. After a swim in the lobster tank, Mr. Bean unwittingly cooks up sweet revenge in the kitchen.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: During a visit to Londons National Gallery, Bean witnesses the theft of a major work of art. Bloodhound that he is, he pursues the culprit across the Channel to Paris only to be waylaid by a Reliant Robin, a traffic jam, and a mime artist under the Eiffel Tower. Will Mr Bean "the International Art Sleuth" prove successful?
